did.head: Descriptive Summary

did.physdesc: This collection consists of 2 photos; 45" in length or longer.

See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: World War I Oversize Photographs, Accession #11547, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased from Jim Presgraves on 1999 August 26.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of two oversized panoramic photographs of World War soldiers who trained in Virginia and various aeronautical and medical units.
Photograph by Shulman of Camp Hancock (Augusta, Ga.), an ordnance training camp, 1918. An unidentified soldier has numbered objects on the photograph and explained them on the verso.
Photograph by Stouts & Simpson of the personnel of Base Hospital Unit No. 165, Waco, Texas, once in the possession of Walter Cook, a soldier in the photograph.

did.unittitle: Ordnance Training Camp, Camp Hancock, Augusta, Georgia, Shulman, Photographer 1918

scopecontent.p: Handwriting on back identifies various parts of camp such as the latrines, bath houses, classrooms, mess houses, and his own tent.

did.unittitle: Base Hospital Unit No. 165, Stouts & Thompson, Photographer, Waco, Texas n.d.

scopecontent.p: Walter Cook (1896-1972) identified on photograph as fourth person on first row.
